thread.title: Who pulled the bigger crowd: Trump or Obama?
thread.title_full: Who pulled the bigger crowd: Trump or Obama?

author: Sasha Lekach
title: Who pulled the bigger crowd: Trump or Obama?
text:
President Donald Trump is all about big crowds, especially when they are gathering for him. There is no doubt the new president would have been thrilled on Friday as hundreds of thousands of people poured into the National Mall in Washington D.C. to witness a Trump presidency in real life.
SEE ALSO: Donald Trump's inauguration address included a Bane Quote:
Despite the yuge gathering, many people shared side-by-side photos on social media to show Trump's crowd compared to Obama's first crowd back in 2009. The shots appear to show a much thinner crowd at Trump's inauguration. But keep in mind photos from earlier in the day can make it look way emptier than it actually was by the time Trump was taking the oath of office.
Here's the crowd at Obama's inauguration in 2009 and at Trump's on Friday:
Image: AP Photo/Susan Walsh
Image: Photo by Scott Olson/Getty Images
Here is the crowd at Obama's second inauguration in 2013 and at Trump's on Friday:
2013.
Image: AP
Image: Photo by Ricky Carioti - Pool/Getty Images
And here's Twitter's take:
The crowd size comparison, from 2009 and today. pic.twitter.com/iMYZy9PRK8
— Matt Viser (@mviser) January 20, 2017
January, 2009: Just so we don't forget, this is what a real grassroots movement looks like pic.twitter.com/U6qFkKmbji
— Dan Pfeiffer (@danpfeiffer) January 20, 2017
Inauguration Crowd:
Obama 2009 vs. Trump 2017
(AP Photo) https://t.co/ebh0R3yVWh pic.twitter.com/EDYGZtHNfl
— Gianni (@giannijannke) January 20, 2017
Others, like Sen. Marco Rubio, seemed impressed with the numbers:
Great crowd on a great day for our country. pic.twitter.com/Sc0iZx5E6E
— Marco Rubio (@marcorubio) January 20, 2017
It is difficult to source the official crowd numbers for Friday's inauguration. Spokespeople for the National Park Service and the U.S. Park Police both advised Mashable they do not provide crowd estimates. The Associated Press said the crowds appeared smaller than in past years, but did not provide an estimate. Mashable also reached out to the Presidential Inauguration Committee, but has yet to hear back about crowd numbers.
PHOTOS: President Donald Trump predicted a record-setting #Inauguration crowd. It didn't work out that way. https://t.co/bpMREFsv7I pic.twitter.com/SHIm4M9ko5
— AP Politics (@AP_Politics) January 20, 2017
Trump has quite the numbers to beat: Obama's second inauguration in 2012 crowd estimates were around 1 million, while back in 2009 a record-high turnout was estimated around 1.8 million, according to Politico .
Back in 2009, supporters came out for Obama's inauguration.
Image: Photo by Robert Nickelsberg/Getty Images
Trump supporters are decked out for his inauguration.
Image: Photo by Patrick Smith/Getty Images
With Trump fixated on size and popularity he's sure be talking about the "bigly" inauguration crowds before long, despite what the official figures end up showing.
